Name: 4-methyl-2-pentanone production | 4-methyl-2-pentanone | EN15804GD, U
Category: C:Manufacturing/20:Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products/201:Manufacture of basic chemicals, fertilizers and nitrogen compounds, plastics/2011:Manufacture of basic chemicals
Description: 4-Methyl-2-pentanone is produced in one step from acetone and hydrogen.;  For this process, a combination of a cation exchanger with palladium is generally used as a catalyst. The acetone is fed with hydrogen over the palladium-charged catalyst at 130 °C and 0.5 – 5.0 MPa. A selectivity of > 95 %  at a conversion of < 50 % is thereby attained. ;Reference:;Siegel, H., Eggersdörfer, M.: Ketons. In: Ullmann's Encyclopedia of Industrial Chemistry, Seventh Edition, 2004 Electronic Release (ed. Fiedler E., Grossmann G., Kersebohm D., Weiss G. and Witte C.). 7 th Electronic Release Edition. Wiley InterScience, New York, Online-Version under: http://www.mrw.interscience.wiley.com/ueic/articles/
